title: [K-12] VR-Based Planetary Science Collaborative Learning Project: Strengthening Social Inquiry and Citizen Science Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic earth science concepts and understanding of solar system components, fundamental communication skills for collaborative problem-solving, introductory awareness of citizen science projects
context.additional_context: A program for pre-service teachers and job seekers, this course explores planetary science education methods applicable in elementary education settings. It develops an educational model integrating scientific inquiry and social collaboration competencies, with a focus on strengthening citizen science capabilities for future generations' sustainable development.

learning_goals: Analyze geological structures (stratigraphy, volcanic terrain) and atmospheric characteristics (composition, pressure) of three planets (e.g., Mars, Venus) in a VR environment. In 3–4 person teams, learners solve a geological exploration mission (e.g., resource extraction site selection) within two weeks, write a collaborative report, and recognize the scientific inquiry process and social responsibility as citizen scientists

Learners systematically record observational data (temperature, humidity, precipitation, etc.) in tabular format ≥once weekly in a Digital Science Journal (DSJ), provide specific feedback (e.g., data accuracy, analysis methods) to three team members, and foster a collaborative learning culture by writing feedback meeting ≥4/5 peer evaluation checklist items

By designing virtual experiments based on planetary formation theories, predicting outcomes, and engaging in team discussions, students explore the scientific decision-making process and methods for reaching social consensus
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
